definition: a person who regularly walks by the river cannot avoid getting their shoes wet (proverb)/(fig.) it comes with the territory (e.g. a person with the power to grant favors will inevitably succumb to temptation and take a bribe)
pinyin: chang2 zai4 he2 bian1 zou3 , na3 you3 bu4 shi1 xie2
simplified: 常在河边走，哪有不湿鞋
word: 常在河邊走，哪有不濕鞋

definition: (located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)
suffix of a noun of locality
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
(emphatic sentence-final particle, used instead of 啊[a5] after a word ending in "n")
which? (interrogative, followed by classifier or numeral-classifier)
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
